title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel that explores themes of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, where the government monitors and controls every aspect of people's lives.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story of decadence, idealism, and obsession in the Roaring Twenties, narrated by Nick Carraway.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing readers to the world of magic and Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A timeless love story featuring the headstrong Elizabeth Bennet and the proud Mr. Darcy.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Follow the adventures of Holden Caulfield as he navigates the challenges of adolescence and adulthood.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Join Bilbo Baggins on his unexpected journey to help a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A vision of a future society characterized by advanced technology, social stability, and a lack of individuality.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a dystopian world, Katniss Everdeen must participate in a televised fight to the death as a symbol of resistance.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first part of the epic journey to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth from the dark lord Sauron.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: In a totalitarian society, women are subjugated and used for reproductive purposes, and one woman seeks to escape.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A story set in a future where books are banned and burned, and one man's journey to preserve knowledge and culture.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: Follow Santiago's journey across the desert to discover his Personal Legend and fulfill his dreams.

title: Gone with the Wind
author: Margaret Mitchell
description: A sweeping epic set during the American Civil War, featuring the headstrong Scarlett O'Hara.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A terrifying story of a family's descent into madness while isolated in a haunted hotel during the winter.
